    • hasData

      public boolean hasData()
      Returns whether this table has any cell, excluding the headline.
      Returns:
      whether the table has any data

    • addHeader

      public TableMessage addHeader(String header)
      Appends a new header entry to this table and increments the column counter.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      header - the contents of this header entry
      Returns:
      this table

    • addHeadline

      public TableMessage addHeadline(String... headers)
      Appends multiple new header entries to this table and increments the column counter.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      headers - the contents of the header entries
      Returns:
      this table

    • addCell

      public TableMessage addCell(String cell)
      Appends a new cell to this table.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      cell - the contents of this cell
      Returns:
      this table

    • addCell

      public TableMessage addCell(Cell cell)
      Appends a cell to this table.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      cell - the cell
      Returns:
      this table

    • addRow

      public TableMessage addRow(String... cells)
      Appends multiple new cells to this table.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      cells - the contents of this cell
      Returns:
      this table

    • addRow

      public TableMessage addRow(Cell... cells)
      Appends multiple cells to this table.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      cells - the contents of this cell
      Returns:
      this table

    • addRow

      public TableMessage addRow(Object... objCells)
      Appends multiple cells to this table. This method accepts an array with each element being either a cell object or a string containing the contents of the new cell.

      Note: All headers have to be added to the table before the first data entry is written.

      Parameters:
      objCells - the cells
      Returns:
      this table

    • setColums

      public void setColums(int count)

    • automaticLineBreaks

      public TableMessage automaticLineBreaks(int column)
      Inserts line breaks in the cells of the specified column so that the table matches the width of an embed on a desktop computer. This method will do nothing if the operation is impossible due to an invalid column index or because there is not enough space for the table.
      Parameters:
      column - the column in which the line breaks are to be inserted
      Returns:
      this table

    • build

      public String build()
      Returns the format code sequence representing this table.
      Returns:
      the formatted contents of this table

    • getCellData

      private Cell getCellData(int r, int c, List<Integer> rowHeights)
      Returns an object representing a single cell in the table on the screen. Multiline rows will be treated as individual rows by this method.
      Parameters:
      r - the row on the screen
      c - the column on the screen
      rowHeights - an array containing the precomputed heights of the rows of the table
      Returns:
      the cell on the screen

    • getCell

      private Cell getCell(int r, int c)
      Returns the cell at the specified position in the table. This method will return an empty cell if the requested cell index is not present in the table. A column argument greater or equal to the total amount of columns will result in undefined behaviour.
      Parameters:
      r - the row of the requested cell
      c - the column of the requested cell
      Returns:
      the cell at the specified position

    • whiteSpace

      private String whiteSpace(int length)
      Returns a string containing space characters. This method will return an empty character if the length argument is zero.
      Parameters:
      length - the number of spaces
      Returns:
      the string containing the spaces

    • formatCell

      private String formatCell(Cell cell)
      Returns the format code sequence representing this cell.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to format
      Returns:
      the formatted contents of the cell
